ul.li1: 1A prayer of Habakkuk the prophet, according to Shigionoth.
2O Yahweh, I have heard the report of you;
ul.li2: O Yahweh, I stand in awe of your works.
ul.li1: In the midst of the years, revive it!
ul.li2: In the midst of the years, make it known!
In wrath, may you remember to show compassion.
ul.li1: 3God came from Teman;
ul.li2: the Holy One from Mount Paran. Selah
ul.li1: His splendor covers the heavens,
ul.li2: and his praise fills the earth.
ul.li1: 4And his brightness was like the light;
ul.li2: flashing rays came from his hand for him;
And there is the covering of his strength.
ul.li1: 5Before him went Disease,The Hebrew term is also the name of a Canaanite deity
ul.li2: and PestilenceThe Hebrew term is also the name of a Canaanite deity went out at his feet.
ul.li1: 6He stood and measured the earth;
ul.li2: he looked and made the nations tremble.
ul.li1: Then the mountains of old were shattered;
ul.li2: the hills of old collapsed.
The ways of old belong to him.
ul.li1: 7Under affliction I saw the tents of Cushan;
ul.li2: the tent curtains of the land of Midian trembled.
ul.li1: 8Was the anger of Yahweh against the rivers?
ul.li2: Was your wrath against the rivers,
or your fury against the sea,
ul.li1: when you mounted upon your horses,
ul.li2: upon your victory chariot?
ul.li1: 9You laid bare the nakedness of your bow,
ul.li2: swearing oaths with the arrows of your word.
You split the earth with rivers.
ul.li1: 10When the mountains saw you they writhed;
ul.li2: a torrent of waters swept by;
ul.li1: the deep gave its voice;
ul.li2: it raised its hands on high.
ul.li1: 11Sun and moon stood still in their place;
ul.li2: at the light of your arrows they moved about;
at the gleam of the flashing of your spear.
ul.li1: 12In fury you marched through the earth;
ul.li2: in anger you trampled the nations.
ul.li1: 13You went forth for the salvation of your people,
ul.li2: for the salvation of your anointed.
ul.li1: You crushed the head of the house of wickedness,
ul.li2: laying bare from the foundation to the top.Or “to the neck”
ul.li1: 14You pierced the head of his warriors with his own arrows;
ul.li2: they came like a whirlwind to scatter me,
their exultation like one who devours the afflicted in ambush.
ul.li1: 15You trampled upon the sea with your horses,
ul.li2: the churning of many waters.
ul.li1: 16I hear and my stomach shakes;
ul.li2: my lips quiver at the sound;
ul.li1: infection enters my bones;
ul.li2: that which is beneath me trembles;
ul.li1: I wait quietly for the day of trouble
ul.li2: to come upon the people attacking us.
ul.li1: 17Though the fig tree does not blossom,
ul.li2: nor there be fruit on the vines;
ul.li1: the yield of the olive tree fails,
ul.li2: and the cultivated fields do not yield food;
ul.li1: the flock is cut off from the animal pen,
ul.li2: and there is no cattle in the stalls,
ul.li1: 18Yet I will rejoice in Yahweh;
ul.li2: I will exult in the God of my salvation.
ul.li1: 19Yahweh, my Lord, is my strength;
ul.li2: he makes my feet like the deer;
he causes me to walk on my high places.
ul.li1: To the choirmaster with stringed instruments.
